variant.question: The message addressed to an Area Control Centre "REQUEST RADAR VECTORS TO CIRCUMNAVIGATE ADVERSE WEATHER" is:

options.text: Use ICAO phraseology, abbreviations or plain language

variant.question: Which word shall be used to ask a station whether you have correctly received a message, clearance, instruction, etc?

In contact with a radar Air Traffic Services unit, an aircraft receives the following three messages (callsigns have been omitted). Which option below lists the correct responses to all of these messages?
1. 'Advise type of transponder capability'
2. 'Check altimeter setting and confirm level'
3. 'Turn left immediately heading 050 to avoid traffic 12 o'clock 3 miles'

options.text:
1. Transponder Sierra
2. Altimeter 1008 altitude 2000 ft
3. Left heading 050

1. Transponder Charlie
2. Altimeter 1008 flight level 110
3. Left immediately 050

1. Transponder Alpha
2. Altimeter 1008 flight level 110
3. Left immediately 050

1. Transponder Bravo
2. Altimeter 1008 altitude 2000 ft
3. Left immediately heading 050

variant.question: After achieving two-way communication, Mudfield Radar gives the following instruction: "GOLF ALFA CHARLIE ZULU GOLF, TRANSMIT FOR IDENTIFICATION AND REPORT HEADING". The pilot should:

options.text: Transmit the following message: “HEADING TWO SEVEN ZERO, GOLF ALFA CHARLIE ZULU GOLF.”
Reselect Mode S on the transponder and transmit: “HEADING TWO SEVEN ZERO, GOLF ALFA CHARLIE ZULU GOLF.”
Select IDENT on the transponder and transmit: “HEADING TWO SEVEN ZERO, GOLF ALFA CHARLIE ZULU GOLF.”
Select SBY on the transponder and transmit: “HEADING TWO SEVEN ZERO, GOLF ALFA CHARLIE ZULU GOLF.”

RADAR informs aircraft X-BC 
'X-BC identified'
What does this mean?

options.text: X-BC should perform an identification turn.
X-BC is not visible on the radar screen.

variant.question: What is the meaning of the phrase "Radar service terminated"?

options.text: You will no longer be provided with radar control.
ATC wants you to continue VFR.
ATC wants you to reset transponder.
You are now leaving the Terminal Area.

variant.question: The crew of a flight operated under the callsign Gulfstream HTK is cleared for departure via RNAV departure route PONTI4G. Due to degraded equipment functions, the aircraft does not meet the navigational accuracy for this specific RNAV procedure. What would be the correct phrase to advise ATC of that issue?

options.text: Gulfstream HTK UNABLE RNAV DUE EQUIPMENT
Gulfstream HTK UNABLE PONTI4G DEPARTURE DUE RNAV TYPE
Gulfstream HTK NEGATIVE PONTI4G DEPARTURE DUE EQUIPMENT

variant.question: For an aircraft which is over 136 000 kg, what word should be included in the initial radiotelephony contact?

options.text: Nothing, use the normal callsign only.

variant.question: What is the correct phraseology to tell ATC that you are not RNAV equipped?
Two aircraft with similar registrations are flying in the same airspace, EC-ITY and ES-LTY. What is ATC doing to avoid mistakes when sharing the same radio frequency?

options.text: ATC will not abbreviate the call signs in order to avoid mistakes.
It is impossible to abbreviate those call signs.
ATC will abbreviate the call sign on its own discretion.

options.text: The controller wants to know which code is set on the transponder.
The controller wants you to repeat your last transmission once again.
The controller requests the registration of the aircraft.
The controller wants you to transmit your bearing.

variant.question: After establishing communication with the ATC radar unit for approach the controller tells you: "G-ACBG, for ILS runway 22, fly heading 215". What does it mean?

options.text: The aircraft should turn onto a heading of 215 degrees.
The ILS track to the runway is 215 degrees.
The heading to maintain the runway track is 215 degrees.
The heading to maintain the ILS track will be 215 degrees.

G-ACZG, request monitor ONE TWO FIVE DECIMAL SEVEN SEVEN FIVE.

variant.question: Radar information relating to conflicting traffic should be given whenever possible in the following form:

options.text: Relative bearing in clock term; distance from; direction of flight of conflicting traffic and level, type and relative speed (slow or fast). Relative movement should be described as crossing, parallel or opposite direction.
Relative bearing in degrees left or right; heading; speed; height.
Relative bearing in degrees Magnetic; speed; height and heading.
Relative bearing in degrees True; speed; height and heading of conflicting traffic.

Turn right onto 150° magnetic and select IDENT on your transponder.

variant.question: Apart from giving vectors, requesting a report of position, requesting the aircraft to make turns and the use of SSR, what other way is there for ATC to identify an aircraft?

the aircraft is subject to positive control and separation from other traffic will be provided.
the pilot does not have to follow up and report the position of the aircraft.
